result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott J LaPorte was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Reckless Homicide, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.06(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration or Substance Abuse Program.
Credit for 307 days.

superMiscConds.notes:
Restitution of $7,117.89 for funeral expenses and $1,025.00 for the Gravestone to be paid to Jerry N. (victim's father) to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision and joint and severally with Brittany T.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Court costs to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.
DNA surcharge is WAIVED.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or combination of schooling.
Submit to AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
No contact with Brittany T. or the victim's family.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Scott J LaPorte in court, in custody, with attorney Eugene E. Detert.    Susan Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties proceed to sentencing on Ct. 1. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- Total sentence: 10 years (Initial Confinement: 5 years - credit for 307 days, Extended Supervision: 5 years)
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration 
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program. 
- Court Costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- Restitution of $7117.89 for funeral expenses and $1025 for the Gravestone to be paid to Jerry N. (Victim's Father) to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision and joint and severally with Brittany T..
- DNA Surcharge is waived.
- Conditions of  Extended Supervision: AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling or any other approved activity by agent. No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed. No contact with Brittany T. or the victim's family.   Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Defendant Scott J LaPorte in court, in custody, with attorney Eugene E. Detert.   Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended Information filed - reading waived. Parties request a separate date for sentencing. Court grants request. Court orders a Presentence investigation to be compiled and filed within 60 days. Court orders bail revoked. Court will set a sentencing date.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
